calculate_metrics

postprocessinglib.evaluation.metrics.calculate_metrics(observed: DataFrame, simulated: DataFrame, metrices: list[str], num_stations: int) → dict[str, float]

Calculate the requested metrics.

Parameters:

  • observed (pd.DataFrame) – Observed values[1: Day of the year; 2: Streamflow Values]

  • simulated (pd.DataFrame) – Simulated values[1: Day of the year; 2: Streamflow Values]

  • metrices (List[str]) – List of metrics to be calculated

  • num_min (int) – number of days required to “warm up” the system

Returns:

dict{str – A dictionary containing each metric to be evaluated and its result

Return type:

float}

JUPYTER NOTEBOOK EXAMPLE

Example

Calculation of a list of metrics

 1from postprocessinglib.evaluation import metrics
 2
 3observed_all, simulated_all = metrics.generate_dataframes(csvfpath="MESH_output_streamflow.csv", num_min=365)
 4
 5list_of_metrices = ["MSE", "NSE", "KGE 2012"]
 6
 7print(metrics.calculate_metrics(observed=observed_all, simulated=simulated_all, metrices=list_of_metrices, num_stations=2))
 8
 9{'MSE': [1889.8829356273197, 665.8655715367416], 'NSE': [0.0994826408059557, -3.582905524779485],
10'KGE 2012': [0.3130173067471582, -0.1483398188302718]}

1# You can type in "all" as well to calculate all metrics
2print(metrics.calculate_metrics(observed=observed_all, simulated=simulated_all, metrices="all";, num_stations=1))
3
4{'MSE': [1889.8829356273197], 'RMSE': [43.47278384952268], 'MAE': [25.140806861503677], 'NSE': [0.0994826408059557],
5'NegNSE': [-0.0994826408059557], 'LogNSE': [-0.33425398964890385], 'NegLogNSE': [0.33425398964890385], 'KGE': [0.4391875106526365],
6'NegKGE': [-0.4391875106526365], 'KGE 2012': [0.3130173067471582], 'BIAS': [-34.59860016110435], 'AbsBIAS': [34.59860016110435],
7'TTP_obs': [154.8], 'TTP_sim': [180.84], 'TTCoM_obs': [184.87057921300135], 'TTCoM_sim': [190.60358617846887], 'SPOD_obs': [72.0],
8'SPOD_sim': [76.12]}
